dataList.content: İzin ver de sana emir vermenin ve yönetmenin temellerini göstereyim.
Günahkârlara, ekranın alt tarafında gördüğün Panel üzerinden Yetenekleri birleştirerek (zincirleyerek) emirler verebilirsin.
Sol tarafta gördüğün dişliye basılı tut.
Ve sağ taraftaki dişliye kadar Yetenekler seçerek bir Yetenek zinciri oluştur.
Bir Yetenek zinciri oluşturduktan sonra, savaşı başlatmak için sağdaki dişliye dokun.

Görünüşüe göre daha güçlü bir hücuma ihtiyacımız var.
Hadi gerekli zinciri oluşturalım.
Aynı Türden 2 veya daha fazla Yeteneği zincirleyerek, bir <Rezonans> oluşturursun.
Rezonans

Rezonanslar, aynı Günah Türüne sahip
Yetenekleri güçlendirirler. (Başka bir deyişle, aynı renk.)
Her Yeteneğin gücü ondan önce gelenler kadar artar.

Yeterli olmadı. Daha da sert saldırmalıyız.
Bir daha deneyelim.
Aynı Tür 3 veya daha fazla Yeteneği art arda zincirleyerek, bir <Tam Rezonans> oluşturursun.
Tam Rezonans Nedir?

Dediğim gibi, Aynı Tür 3 veya daha fazla Yeteneği art arda zincirlemek <Tam Rezonans>ı tetikler.
<Tam Rezonans> altındaki her Yetenek toplam sayıya göre güç kazanır.
Kazanılan güç Yetenek sayısı arttıkça artar.
Savaş alanındaki birliklerin canlarında sarı renkte 'Sersemleme Eşikleri' görebilirsin.
Sersemleme nedir?

Bir saldırı, bir birliğin canını bu eşiklerden birinin altına düşürürse, bu birlik <Sersemler>.
<Sersemlemişken>, tüm Fiziksel Dirençler 'Ölümcül' olur.
Eğer tek bir turda bir birimin canı birkaç Sersemleme Eşiği düşerse, onun <Sersemleme Seviyesi> artar.
Bu <Sersemleme Seviyesi> 3'e kadar çıkabilir, arttıkça, birimin aldığı hasar şiddetlenir.
Aferin. Bir düşmanı <Sersemlettik>. Şimdi, sana öğrettiklerimi kullanarak savaşmaya devam et.
All actions are dictated by a <Speed> value.
What is Speed?

Speed is a random number chosen from within a given range each turn.
The positions of units are rearranged every turn according to their Speeds.
Those with lower Speeds are placed at the front, making them easier targets.

Before using a skill, characters will flip Coins to determine its final Power value.
Higher Power means higher damage.
The number of Coins indicates how many attacks are made. Two Coins means two hits.

Before using a skill, characters will flip Coins to determine its final Power value.
Higher Power means higher damage.

Usually, if a Coin lands on heads, its Power will be added to the skill’s Power.
Looks like the skill will be strengthened this time.
The added Power persists over to the next coin toss.
At the start of each turn, a skill slot will be added for a Sinner in the order they were deployed during team setup, regardless of if the Sinner is <Staggered>, <in Panic>, or <E.G.O corrosion>.
When a Sinner and their target both use attack skills, a <Clash> occurs.
What are Clashes?

A <Clash> occurs when two characters attack each other.
The side with the higher Power wins, removing 1 Coin from the loser.
If both sides still have Coins, more Clashes will occur until one side has lost all of its Coins.
The side that loses all their Coins will have their attack skill canceled.
The winner will then attack with their remaining Coins, gaining a damage bonus based on the total number of Clashes.

In a <Clash>, the Clash Power of two opposing skills is compared, and the side with greater Power wins.
The gauge and text shown at the top of the screen predict your odds of winning.
When a Clash begins, the two characters will each toss a Coin to determine their skills’ power in the Clash. Then, the side with more Power wins and destroys the opponent’s Coin.

The Clash will continue until one side has run out of Coins.
When a character’s final Coin is destroyed, their skill is canceled, and the Clash will end in complete defeat.
The blue orb next to a character’s health bar is an indicator of their <Sanity>, or SP.
What is Sanity?

The sphere on a unit’s right indicates their <Sanity>, or SP. It has a range of -45 to +45.
Units with higher Sanity have a higher chance of their Coin flips landing heads.
Defeating enemies boosts Sanity, while ally deaths will harm Sanity.
Enemy units at low Sanity may fall into states of “Low Morale” or “Panic”.
You can view the effects and ailments on a unit in the indicated area.
Press or hover over one of the effect icons to examine it in detail.
All of our foes have fallen into panic. Now’s our chance. Give us orders at your discretion.
Please form a chain of skills. I have more to teach you.
Attack Types and Affinities

Skills have two major properties:
Their <Attack Type> and <Sin Affinity>.
The Attack Types are Slash, Pierce, and Blunt.
The Sin Affinities are Wrath, Lust, Sloth, Gluttony, Gloom, Pride, and Envy.
Combined with Resistances, Attack Types and Affinities determine the damage of skills.
Here, you can check the Attack Type and Sin Affinity of your Sinners' Skills.
You can see the resistances and weaknesses of each unit up here. This hooligan is vulnerable to Slash attacks.

You can also use defense skills to deal with an enemy offense.
Defense skills activate against the enemy attack paired with it.
If a defense skill isn't paired, it will activate when the unit is subject to an unopposed attack.
Unlike attack skills, defense skills need to be generated.
Let’s generate a Guard skill first.
If you’d be so kind as to press Gregor’s portrait.
Defense Skills: Guard

Guard creates a shield with health equal to its Power value.
This shield will absorb incoming damage first.
Using Guard multiple times in a single turn will have it activate that many times.

Good. A Guard skill has been generated.
Let’s do the same for a Counter skill.
If you’d be so kind as to press Rodya’s portrait.
Defense Skills: Counter

Unlike other defense skills, Counter has an Affinity and will generate its corresponding E.G.O resource.
When using Counter, the unit will launch an unopposed attack after being hit.
However, the unit cannot launch a Counter while Staggered.

Gut gemacht.
Lastly, we’ll generate an Evade skill.
If you’d be so kind as to press Faust’s portrait.
Defense Skills: Evade

When using Evade, the character will dodge if the Evade’s final Power value is greater than or equal to the incoming attack’s.
The attack will hit with full force if the Evade’s Power is lower, so be careful.

These skills have been generated without a problem.
Now, utilize them and continue the battle.
Your goal is to eliminate all of our enemies.

In dungeons, creatures we call <Abnormalities> exist.
Encounters with them will be unavoidable.
Abnormalities and their Parts

Abnormalities consist of at least one body part.
Each part has its own slots, as well as individual skills.
Choose one of your Sinner’s skills and drag it to the Abnormality’s skill slot.

Abnormality skills also have <Speed> values.
Alongside determining the order of actions, an Abnormality’s Speeds are something to pay attention to when you wish to redirect its attacks.
When you order a Sinner with *higher* Speed to target one of the Abnormality’s skill slots, it will be forced to engage in a <Clash> with its new target.
Drag a skill belonging to a character with higher Speed to change the Abnormality’s target.
You’ve redirected the Abnormality’s target. These two will now get into a Clash this turn.

By using Speed this way,
you can freely manipulate who an Abnormality attacks.
In Focused Encounters, it is vital to *switch targets*
so that they are forced into Clashes that will play out in your favor.
Now, give your orders to the rest of the Sinners.
After you’ve planned out your Sinners’ moves, press here to begin combat.
Breaking Parts

When the HP of a body part is reduced to 0, it is <Broken>.
A broken part becomes vulnerable to all physical attack types.
Some parts may lose certain skills or passives after breaking.
Do note that some Abnormalities have regenerative parts, as well as that breaking certain ones may instead enrage an Abnormality.

You may find Abnormalities with multiple parts in the dungeons you explore.
In such cases, each part will have different Resistances and Passives, and use different skills.

We’ve prepared an <Abnormality Encyclopedia> for occasions like this.
It lists the Resistances, Skills, and Passives for each part.
Select an Abnormality to view its entry.

However, the encyclopedia is incomplete at the moment.
Surface-level analysis can only yield so much information.
Our entries will be supplemented with more info as you encounter Abnormalities in the field.

The Abnormality Encyclopedia records information on Abnormalities and their parts.
By nature, the Encyclopedia starts out incomplete.
The more you fight an Abnormality, the more its entry will be penned in the Encyclopedia.
After enough encounters, the Observation Level for the Abnormality will go up.
Higher Observation Levels increase the damage you deal against an Abnormality.

During Focused Encounters, you may occasionally be tasked to make key <Decisions>.
These require you to choose a Sinner or an action based on your current situation.
An Abnormality’s response may vastly differ by the choices you make, so choose wisely.
Area-of-Effect Skills

Area-of-Effect skills, or AoE skills for short, have an attack weight (Atk Weight) assigned to them.
The targets of an AoE skill depend on its targeting range. (Front, Middle, Back, Special, etc.)
With AoE skills, Clashes can only occur against the manually targeted unit.
If an AoE skill loses in a Clash, the attack will be canceled against all its targets.
Defense skills will still activate against AoE skills.
